result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Retain Possession (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(e).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: #1 - CD squad video, #2 - CD body camera video

Defendant Scott A Kelley in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Scott A Kelley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Kussel appears via video from Shawano County. Called 10:07 AM. Off record, 10:08 AM. On record, 10:09 AM to provide Burns with fax number. Off record, 10:10 AM for Burns to fax PLQ and for Court to check for video that was sent by the DA. Back on the record, 10:16 AM. Court informs DA has not received a disc/video from the DA's office. Court questions if DA would like to adjourn due to the video not being seen. DA questions if video could be played via video. Court does not feel that would be sufficient. Kelley does not object to video being put on video, wants to proceed today. Court checks video equipment and does not feel it would be good representation of video. Burns objects to adjourn. Kelley makes statement to the judge that he is not denying anything on the video, which he has seen prior to today's date. Court questions if there is a joint recommendation. State indicates there is not a joint recommendation, parties are free to argue and states if DE would make statement under oath regarding his degree of recklesness which is shown in video, he would be willing to proceed. Court swears in Scott A Kelley, 10:27 AM. Court advises of appearing via video vs. appearing in person, Kelley does not object to video appearance and asks to make statement regarding his actions on the offense date. State indicates a plea has not been done. Court will proceed with plea. Kelley will be entering guilty pleas to Counts #1, #3, DA indicates counts #4 & #7 to be amended to 941.30(2) class G felony, all other counts will be DRI. Free to argue sentence. Court has PLQ and goes over the form with the defendant, finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea and constitutional rights and right to jury trial. Court finds factual bases and adjudges guilty to Counts #1 & #3 and to #4 & #7 as amended, Court advises of elements and penalties of amended charges. Court DRI counts #2, #5, #6, #8 & #9. State has complied with all victim recommendations, recites recommendation Count 1 - 9 months in FC jail concurrent to all other counts on this case but consecutive to current sentence, count 3 - 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 4 years of incarceration and 2 years extended supervision, Counts 4 & 7 - 8 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 4 years of incarceration and 4 years of extended supervision on both counts, all counts to run concurrent but consecutive to current sentence, State makes final argument. State offers exhibits # 1 (squad video) & #2 (body camera video). No objections. Court accepts exhibits #1 & #2. Court asks for statement of Kelley. State is willing to forgo statement due to previous statements of the defendant today in court. Burns makes final argument and asks court to consider an Imposed and stayed sentence 5 years of incarceration and 5 years of extended supervision, with probation on all four counts. Kelley makes statement, remorseful. Court proceeds to sentencing, following recommendation of the state: Count #1 - 9 months in FC jail consecutive to current term serving but concurrent to other counts on this case. Count 3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison system with 4 years incarceration and 2 years of extended supervision. Counts 4 & 7 - 8 years in WI Prison system 4 years incarceration and 4 years extended supervision on each count, all concurrent to each other but consecutive to current term serving. Burns questions jail credit. Court advises served on a revocation no jail credit given. Must submit DNA with surcharges on count 4 only. Conditions of extended supervision as deemed fit by DOC agent, eligible for all programs. Advised of voting rights/firearms.
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court who appears telephonically.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:23 PM. Burns - resolved - but defendant is currently incarcerated at Oshkosh Correctional Institute - out day is 5/8/16 and would like this matter scheduled before then. Recess to get a new date (1:27 PM). Recalled at 1:39 PM with same appearances. We have set this matter for a PLEAS on 4/26/16 at 9:00 AM, Judge Kussel and CR will appear via video from Shawano County and the defendant, DA and Attorney Burns will appear in person in Forest County.
Sentencing - defense - original mailed directly to Judge Kussell

Called 4:10 pm. Attorney Mary L.R. Burns appeared by phone means for Defendant Scott A Kelley. Prosecuting Atty Charles James Simono appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott A Kelley not in court.  Burns indicates that they have an agreement; 2/16 JT is not needed; will be arguing sentence and not requesting PSI. March 31, 2016 @ 10:15 am Plea & Sentencing.  Bond continued.

Called 8:35 am. Attorney Mary Burns in person. Charles Simono on behalf of the state. Case was not called on the record - was held with the JA from Shawano County. Burns updated on status of case. Defendant is currently incarcerated at Oshkosh Correction and she will be meeting with him the Monday after Christmas and will have a better idea then what status is and if jury trial go. Reset the matter for another telephone conference on 1/5/16 @ 3:45 pm. Attorney Burns may appear via phone.

Telephone conference at 12-02-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 02-16-2016 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:13 PM. State updates Court on case, set for status conference, Burns just took over the case from Attorney Rielly who was terminated from the case. Burns responds, set for another STC. State prefers it be set for JT. Court continues bond, sets for JT on 2/16/15 and set for telephonic status conference on 12/2/15 at 8:30 AM, parties to call in to Shawano County Circuit Court Branch II.  Telephone conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Kelley in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Scott A Kelley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:14 AM. Also called 14TR688. State - here today for change of plea and to got o sentencing. Counsel agrees. Court has plea questionnaire. State - G to count #1, #3 as alleged, #4 - amend to 2nd degree endangering safety with repeater contrary to 941.30(2), #7 - amend to 2nd degree endangering safety with repeater contrary to 941.30(2), #9 as alleged, free to argue for sentence, all other countts DRI and provides court with plea settlement recommendation that has been signed by all parties. Rielly agrees. Kelley did not think the repeater allegations were going to apply. Off record to allow counsel time to explain plea recommendation (9:19 AM). Back on record at 9:23 AM with same appearances. Rielly states that during the recess the defendant has again decided to fire counsel but also mentioned that he wants to continue today, Rielly doesn't believe that ethically he can continue for stated reasons. Kelley makes statement, would like to fire Rielly but still wants to proceed on his own today. Court responds, wants to make sure the defendant wants to proceed on his own. Kelley responds, just wants to get it over with. State makes comment, believes the defendant doesn't totally understand plea agreement, etc. Kelly responds, wants to get it over with today. Rielly makes statement. Kelley informs Court what he thought the plea agreement was and the penalties. Court makes decision/ruling - not convinced that the defendant is able to effectively represent himself, Court not allowing the defendant to represent himself today, will still allow the defendant to discharge his attorney, will continue the matter. Kelley wants to proceed today with Rielly if possible. State responds, believes adjourning matter is best way to proceed today. Kelley wants to discharge counsel. Court discharges Rielly, off record for scheduling, SPD will need to appoint new counsel. Back on record, continues bond, set for status conference telephonic on 10/20/15 at 8:15 AM, telephonic, counsel to call Shawano County.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Scott A Kelley in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Scott A Kelley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:28 AM. Also called 14TR688. Rielly - not resolved - set for JT. Court continues bond, sets for JT. State -all discovery has been completed. Rielly - no MIL anticipated being filed.  Court continues bond, set for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Kelley in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant Scott A Kelley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:26 PM. Also called 14TR688. Rielly has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts and traffic matter, set for FPT. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set both matters for FPT on 4/28/15 at 9:45 AM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Prior: 5976 Terrace Road Apt. B-3, Florence, WI 54121

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: and certificate of appearance - Deputy DB

Called at 4:22 PM. Scott Kelley appears in person and in custody with attorney Michael Rielly. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State calls Deputy Donald Belland. Belland sworn in at 4:22 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Rielly at 4:32 PM. Re-direct by State at 4:36 PM. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (4:36 PM). Belland excused at 4:36 PM. State calls Deputy Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 4:36 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Rilley at 4:41 PM. Re-cross by State at 4:44 PM. Ashbeck excused at 4:44 PM. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Rielly files request for substittion. Court continues bond.
Preliminary hearing on December 11, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Called at 10:06 AM. Scott Kelley appears via video from FOSO and his counsel Michael Rielly appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Court has previously read charges and penalties. Rielly waives further reading, requests PH but wants within time limits. Court continues bond, set for PH on 12/11/14 at 4:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 10, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Called at 9:59 AM. Scott Kelley appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Kelley does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Kelley does not understand charges and penalties but will consult with an attorney. Court questions defendant. Defendant understands charges but does not agree with them, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own. Kelley states that he was informed he had Tom Roley as an attorney but has not met with him yet. Court can recall the case this afternoon when Tom Roley is scheduled in Court. Kelley would prefer to fire Mr. Roley for stated reasons. Burns instructs defendant that he can call SPD and request another attorney appointed. Court will continue bond, set for AIA on 12/10/14 at 9:45 AM. Defendant states he is being revoked on previous charges.
REFUSED TO SIGN. No consumption of alcohol.
